result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Akio Holden

records.addlTxt:
10:17 AM Defendant Brandon Akio Holden in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Brandon Akio Holden.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF224 and 22CF225. State recites the agreement. Defendant will plead to count 1 and 2. Counts 1and 2 will be amended to remove the repeater allegations. Sentence withheld in favor of 4 years of probation. Conditions of 140 days jail with credit for 63 days, Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC, restitution to Centricity Credit Union in the amount of $306 plus 10% surcharge, and a fine of $25 plus costs. State has complied with Victim's rights. 
Defendant pleads no contest to amended counts 1 and 2 without repeater modifiers. Attorney Rosenthal stipulates to a factual basis. Court finds that the defendant's pleas have been knowingly and voluntarily made. Defendant is found guilty. Counts 3 and 4 of 22CF224 are dismissed but read in. Count 1 in 22CF225 is dismissed but read in. 
Court orders on counts 1, 4 years of probation. Count 2 a sentence withheld in favor of 3 years of probation. Conditions of 140 days jail with credit for 63 days, Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC, restitution in the amount of $306 plus 10% surcharge, and a fine of $25 plus costs. Probation concurrent on each count and concurrent conditions. 120 days to pay fine.

9:41 AM Defendant Brandon Akio Holden in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Brandon Akio Holden.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. For 22CF224 and 22CF225, Attorney Rosenthal received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Court sets status conference. For 22CF224 and 22CF225, Attorney Rosenthal asks for both files to be amended to signature bond and defendant would enter into treatment center. States defendant has AODA needs. State is opposed to bail modification, defendant is young and has a limited criminal history his offenses are serious. Defendant absconded from probation and was staying where he should not have and cannot follow court or probation orders. Finds defendant is a flight risk. Attorney Rosenthal defendant has significant ties and cannot post cash bail. Court reviews reasoning for bail. Court denies bail modification.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's motion and notice of motion to modify bail conditions

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 09:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon Akio Holden
Current: 612 Roosevelt Ave, Superior, WI 54880 United States  (Effective: 06-16-2022)
Prior: Homeless, Superior, WI 54880
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon Akio Holden appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Brandon Akio Holden. Court calls cases 22CF224 and 22CF225. Attorney Hoffman updates address with the court. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of both complaints, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $3500 cash in 22CF224 No contact with Victim 1, address of Victim, and Centricity Credit Union. State asks for $500 cash bail 22CF225. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. State recites defendant's criminal history. Indicates that the defendant has been on absconder status in probation. DOC prohibits defendant from being at address he has provided the court. Defendant provides alternate address. Attorney Hoffman indicates that he has lived in Douglas County for 10 years. Indicates that there may be a probation hold. Can post up to $200 total. Court cites concerns over defendant's history and absconder status on probation. Court reviews current pending charges. Court orders $3500 cash in 22CF224 No contact with Victim 1, address of Victim, and Centricity Credit Union. State asks for $500 cash bail 22CF225. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
